sentences.english: Where are you coming from now?
I'm coming from Brussels, Belgium.
Aha! I'm coming from Rome.

sentences.finnish: Ai! Roomasta, voi! Rooma on niin kaunis vanha kaupunki.
sentences.english: Oh! From Rome, oh! Rome is such a beautiful old city.

sentences.finnish: Joo, onhan se! Mutta täällä Frankfurtissa ei ole nyt ollenkaan kaunista kun sataa ja on sumuista. Tulitko sinä tänne lomalle?
sentences.english: Yes, it is! But it's not beautiful at all now in Frankfurt when it's raining and foggy. Did you come here on vacation?

sentences.finnish: En, minä jatkan matkaa illalla, entä sinä?
sentences.english: No, I'm continuing my journey tonight, what about you?

sentences.finnish: Minä olen Frankfurtissa työmatkalla. Olen täällä yhdessä konferenssissä.
sentences.english: I'm on a business trip in Frankfurt. I'm here at a conference.
Aha!

sentences.finnish: Mutta sinä matkustat eteenpäin. Mihin sinä lennät illalla?
sentences.english: But you're continuing your journey. Where are you flying in the evening?

sentences.finnish: Lennän ensin Helsingiin ja siellä olemme pari tuntia. Sitten lentokone jatkaa Tokioon Japaniin.
sentences.english: I'm flying to Helsinki first, and we'll be there for a couple of hours. Then the plane continues to Tokyo, Japan.

sentences.finnish: Oi! Sinulla on sitten kaksi pitkää lentoa.
sentences.english: Oh! You have then two long flights.

sentences.finnish: Niin on! Mutta entä sinä kun konferenssi loppuu, matkustatko takaisin Italiaan?
sentences.english: That's right! But what about you, when the conference ends, are you traveling back to Italy?

sentences.finnish: Ei, en palaa vielä Roomaan, vaan jatkan täältä perjantaina Pariisiin. Se on onneksi tosi lyhyt lento. Vain puoli tuntia.
sentences.english: No, I'm not returning to Rome yet, but I'm continuing from here to Paris on Friday. It's fortunately a really short flight. Only half an hour.
Yes, that's right!
Where does the man come from?
The man comes from Rome.
Where does the woman come from?
The woman comes from Brussels, Belgium.
Where are they?
They are now in Frankfurt.
Where does the man fly?
The man flies to Paris.
Where does the woman fly?

sentences.finnish: Nainen lentää ensin Helsinkiin ja sitten Tokioon Japaniin.
sentences.english: The woman flies first to Helsinki and then to Tokyo Japan.
